longTitle.p: An Act to provide for the transfer of control over pilotage on the
River Hooghly to the Commissioners for the Port of Calcutta.

item.p: " appointed day" means the date on which this Act comes into force;
" Commissioners" means the Commissioners for the Port of

item.p: " Hooghly area" means the part of the Hooghly River extending from the Port of Calcutta to the sea to which section 31 of the Indian Ports Act, 1908 (15 of 1908)

section.heading: Commissioners' duty to maintain pilots. As from the appointed day it shall be the duty of the Commissioners to maintain pilots for the safe navigation of vessels in the Hooghly area and the

content.p: Commissioners shall be bound to maintain a sufficient number of pilots for the purpose as may be prescribed by the Central Government from time to time.

section.heading: Appointment of pilots. No person shall be appointed to be a pilot by the Commissioners who is not for the time being authorised by the Central

blockList.listIntroduction: The Commissioners may from time to time make rules--

item.p: for fixing and regulating the salaries, wages and allowances for pilotage to be received by the pilots,
for regulating the behaviour and conduct of pilots,

content.p: and may enforce the observance of such rules by the imposition of pecuniary penalties not exceeding two hundred rupees for every breach thereof or by suspension or deprivation of appointment or otherwise,
as to them may appear expedient:

Provided that any such order made by the Commissioners shall, as respects any officer whose salary amounts to or exceeds one thousand rupees, be subject to the previous sanction of the Central Government.
No such rules shall take effect until they are approved by the Central Government and published in the Official Gazette.

section.heading: Levy of pilotage fees. As from the appointed day the

content.p: Commissioners shall be entitled to levy fees for the pilotage of vessels in the Hooghly area at rates fixed under the Indian Ports Act,

section.heading: Pilotage fees and fines and penalties levied under the Act.

content.p: All fees for pilotage and all fines and penalties levied under this

Act from pilots or other persons employed in the pilot service, except fines and penalties imposed by a Court, shall be accounted for and expended by the Commissioners in accordance with the provisions of section 36 of the Indian Ports Act, 1908 (15 of 1908).]

section.heading: Power to transfer moneys from the general account to pilotage account and vice versa.
